page.title: 05CHEESE MAKING LOWER HEATH
page.content: First they put 600galls of{milk}in the cheese vat from the 300 cows.Then they put 1 bucket of{sour milk}in,as a starter.Then they leave it for 2 hours .Then they put 15 oz of{rennet}in, which comes from the 4th stomach in a calf.Then they heat it at 86 degrees for 40 mins.Then they stir it and cut it all around.Then they drain the{whey out and give it to the{pigs}to fatten them.Then the cheese is crumbled and then ground up.Then they weigh it and put it in the moulds.After that they put it in the press for a day.Then they put{calico}round it to stop it go ing out of shape or mouldy.Then they stamp it to show what day it was made. Then it is kept{6 weeks}in the store room. After that they get a cheese iron and try it.{Appleby's Cheshire {cheeses}win lots of prizes and are sold to shops all over England.
